repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Financial Markets Development
            Technical Assistance Project; Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan; and First, Second Programmatic Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
In regard to project performance
            assessment ratings, the Financial Markets Development
            Technical Assistance Project of Colombia had the following
            ratings: outcome was moderately satisfactory; sustainability
            was likely; institutional development impact was modest;
            Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory; and borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. The Financial
            Sector Adjustment Loan had the following ratings: outcome
            was satisfactory; sustainability was likely; institutional
            development impact was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory; and borrower performance was
            satisfactory. The First Programmatic Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project had the following ratings: outcome
            was satisfactory; sustainability was likely; institutional
            development impact was substantial; Bank performance was
            satisfactory; and borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Finally, the Second Programmatic Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project had the following ratings: outcome was
            moderately satisfactory; sustainability was likely;
            institutional development impact was substantial; Bank
            performance was satisfactory; and borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from this assessment included:
            accurate, up-to-date sector information and analytical
            knowledge is critical for an adequate support to the
            financial sector; agility and quick reaction to crises
            requires adequate technical resources and streamlined
            decision-making; agility, flexibility, and openness to
            change are also crucial during implementation of a project
            or program; exploiting the synergies among different Bank
            instruments is crucial; and a programmatic approach to
            financial sector reforms is likely to require a time horizon
            of several years to allow for policy and institutional
            reforms to be translated into outcomes and results.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Financial Sector Adjustment
            Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Financial Sector
            Adjustment Operation Project for Colombia was highly
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was high, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was highly satisfactory. The lessons learned indicated that
            ample preparatory work is needed, in particular analysis of
            the sector is critical to the success of the loan. In the
            case of the financial sector adjustment loan, the Government
            had already started to prepare analysis of the financial
            sector problems with assistance from the Bank technical
            assistance loan. Strong Government commitment to the program
            along with high quality officials involved in the
            implementation was instrumental in the positive outcome.
            Some reforms of the financial system do not involve the
            passage of legislation. Greater attention to market needs
            and familiarity with new financial instruments is important
            to the success of any new initiative. The Policy Based
            Guarantee, having benefited from the Government's
            compliance with the first tranche of the loan, was
            implemented under an already sound policy platform.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Financial Sector Adjustment
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Program
            Project, will support a comprehensive program of financial
            sector reform, currently implemented by the Government of
            Colombia. The main objectives will be to support: a)
            required changes in financial sector legislation, and
            regulations, to facilitate strengthening of bank
            supervision, and deposit insurance, and, to promote
            efficient resolution of banks facing financial solvency
            problems; b) the institutional capacity strengthening of the
            Superintendency of Banks, and the Bank Deposit Insurance and
            Resolution Agency for Financial Institutions, entity
            responsible for deposit insurance, and bank resolution; c)
            restructuring, re-capitalization, privatization, and, if
            necessary, liquidation of state-owned, and
            "officialized" banks, currently under public
            sector management; and, d) effective implementation of
            special measures to address the immediate impact on the
            financial system, stemming from economic, or other
            emergencies. Co-financing is expected from the
            Inter-American Development Bank, and, the Corporacion Andina
            de Fomento, to support the financial sector reform program.
            There are risks affecting the transition of the financial
            system, though the proposed program emphasizes that,
            financial structural reforms, and efficient resolution of
            credit institutions, will help minimize the risks of a
            systemic crisis.
